page.title: 06TRANSPORT - RAILWAY
page.content:
Donna Watt Age 11
My grandad has worked with the railway for thirty five years as a signal man. When there are trains coming he has to accept them by pulling the signals in the cabin to let them through. It is a single track line that goes from Blair Athol to Dalwhinnie and through to Newtonmore and Kingussie. When he has accepted the train he phones the signal box in Kingussie to tell them where the train is. There is a telephone at the crossing gates and hikers ring up the signal box to see if it is safe to cross the line or not. He works day and night shifts for 7 hours at a time and it is good pay.
